zone.line: on this diversity of power.
I will tell you o Ion what appears
to me to be the cause of this
inequality of power. It is not
that you are possessed of any
science for the illustration of Homer;
but a divine influence moves
x Thou knowest not the period of Joves power?

line.del: Thou canst not count thy years to come of pain?

zone.line: Mercury
alas,
xThou canst not count thy years to come of pain?
Prometheus
They last while Jove must reign, nor more nor less
Do I desire or fear{.}
you, a power like that which
Euripides resides in the stone called
magnet by Euripides & heracleia
by the people. For this stone [?not]
not only attracts iron rings, but
[in] to them
endows them communicates power
